awe6.interfaces.IInputMouse

type
interface
The IInputMouse interface should be implemented by objects wishing to act as virtual mouse controllers.

Screen bounds are based on IFactory.width & IFactory.height.

Instance Variables

deltaScroll(default,null) : Int

The change in scroll position between the current frame and the previous update.

deltaX(default,null) : Int

The horizontal velocity of the mouse position (difference in pixels between current position and previous update's position).

deltaY(default,null) : Int

The vertical velocity of the mouse position (difference in pixels between current position and previous update's position).

isMoving(default,null) : Bool

Returns true if the mouse position is different to the previous update's position.

isWithinScreenBounds(default,null) : Bool

Returns true if the mouse position is within the screen's bounding rectangle (width x height).

relativeCentralisedX(default,null) : Float

The horizontal position of the mouse relative to screen width and offset to screen centre. Range -1...1.

relativeCentralisedY(default,null) : Float

The vertical position of the mouse relative to screen height and offset to screen centre. Range -1...1.

relativeX(default,null) : Float

The horizontal position of the mouse relative to screen width. Range 0...1.

relativeY(default,null) : Float

The vertical position of the mouse relative to screen height. Range 0...1.

scroll(default,null) : Int

The current scroll position. Starts at 0. Range -infinity...infinity.

x(default,null) : Int

The horizontal component of the mouse position.

y(default,null) : Int

The vertical component of the mouse position.

Instance Methods

getButtonDownDuration( ?type : EMouseButton, ?asTime : Bool, ?isPrevious : Bool ) : Float

parameters
?type The mouse button.
?asTime If true then returns duration as milliseconds, else returns duration as frame updates.
?isPrevious If true then returns the previous duration down (the time held prior to the most recent release).
returns
The duration a specific mouse button is down.
Determine the duration a specific mouse button is down.

getButtonDragHeight( ?type : EMouseButton ) : Int

parameters
?type The mouse button.
returns
The vertical movement of the mouse.
Determine the vertical movement of the mouse since a specific mouse button was pressed.

getButtonDragWidth( ?type : EMouseButton ) : Int

parameters
?type The mouse button.
returns
The horizontal movement of the mouse.
Determine the horizontal movement of the mouse since a specific mouse button was pressed.

getButtonLastClickedX( ?type : EMouseButton ) : Int

parameters
?type The mouse button.
returns
The horizontal position of the mouse.
Determine the horizontal position of the mouse when a specific mouse button was last clicked.

getButtonLastClickedY( ?type : EMouseButton ) : Int

parameters
?type The mouse button.
returns
The vertical position of the mouse.
Determine the vertical position of the mouse when a specific mouse button was last clicked.

getButtonUpDuration( ?type : EMouseButton, ?asTime : Bool, ?isPrevious : Bool ) : Float

parameters
?type The mouse button.
?asTime If true then returns duration as milliseconds, else returns duration as frame updates.
?isPrevious If true then returns the previous duration up (the time unused prior to the most recent press).
returns
The duration a specific mouse button is up.
Determine the duration a specific mouse button is up.

getIsButtonDoubleClick( ?type : EMouseButton, ?delay : Int ) : Bool

parameters
?type The mouse button.
?delay The time within which the mouse button must be clicked twice.
returns
Returns true if the mouse button was clicked twice (within the defined time).
Determine if a specific mouse button was clicked twice (within the defined time).

getIsButtonDown( ?type : EMouseButton ) : Bool

parameters
?type The mouse button.
returns
Returns true is the mouse button is currently down, false otherwise.
Determine if a specific mouse button is currently down.

getIsButtonDrag( ?type : EMouseButton, ?delay : Int ) : Bool

parameters
?type The mouse button.
?delay The time which, if exceeded, assumes the mouse is being dragged.
returns
Returns true if the mouse button was down for a duration exceeding delay.
Determine if the mouse is being dragged with a specific mouse button down (for at least the defined delay).

getIsButtonPress( ?type : EMouseButton ) : Bool

parameters
type The mouse button.
returns
Returns true is the mouse button was pressed in the current update, false otherwise.
Determine if a specific mouse button was pressed in the current update frame.

A press is defined as a new down - i.e. was up previous frame, and is down this frame.

getIsButtonRelease( ?type : EMouseButton ) : Bool

parameters
type The mouse button.
returns
Returns true is the mouse button was released in the current update, false otherwise.
Determine if a specific mouse button was released in the current update.

A release is defined as a new up - i.e. was down previous frame, and is up this frame.

getStillCount( ?asTime : Bool ) : Int

parameters
?asTime If true then returns duration as milliseconds, else returns duration as frame updates.
returns
Returns the duration the mouse has been still.
Determine how long the mouse has been still.
